descript.abstract:
This dataset attempts to represent the point locations of every educational program in the state of Minnesota that is currently operational and reporting to the Minnesota Department of Education. It can be used to identify schools, various individual school programs, school districts (by office location), colleges, and libraries, among other programs. Please note that not all school programs are statutorily required to report, and many types of programs can be reported at any time of the year, so this dataset is by nature an incomplete snapshot in time.
Maintenance of these locations are a result of an ongoing project to identify current school program locations where Food and Nutrition Services Office (FNS) programs are utilized. The FNS Office is in the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE). GIS staff at MDE maintain the dataset using school program and physical addresses provided by local education authorities (LEAs) for an MDE database called "MDE ORG". MDE GIS staff track weekly changes to program locations, along with comprehensive reviews each summer. All records have been reviewed for accuracy or edited at least once since January 1, 2020.
Note that there may remain errors due to the number of program locations and inconsistency in reporting from LEAs and other organizations. In particular, some organization types (such as colleges and treatment programs) are not subject to annual reporting requirements, so some records included in this file may in fact be inactive or moved to a different location.
Note that multiple programs may occur at the same location and are represented as separate records. For example, a junior and a senior high school may be in the same building, but each has a separate record in the data layer. Users can make use of the "CLASS" and "ORGTYPE" attributes to filter and sort records according to their needs. In general, records at the same physical address will be located at the same coordinates.
This data is now available in CSV format. For that format only, OBJECTID and Shape columns are removed, and the Shape column is replaced by Latitude and Longitude columns.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this layer is to provide location information for educational programs operating within the state of Minnesota. These locations are used by MDE to help identify where appropriate funds should be used for that school year. Note that since multiple programs may operate within the same building (at the same address), this dataset is not particularly useful as a "school building" dataset. Some, but not all, public school buildings are represented as discrete records in the related struc-school-buildings dataset.

timeperd.current: Updated annually for the school year identified in the title.

theme.themekey: structure, school, schools, public school, nonpublic school, non-public school, charter school, public school district office, library, libraries, educational program, college, university, school program, school programs

If you modify it, you are encouraged to apply responsible best practices by documenting those changes in a metadata record. If you transmit or provide the data to another user, it is your responsibility to provide appropriate content, limitation, warranty and liability information as you see fit.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

attracc.attraccr: Several checks are performed manually, such as comparing addresses in the GIS data against the physical addresses in MDE ORG. Other attributes, such as GRADERANGE, CLASS, and WEB_URL, were derived from MDE ORG via SQL queries in order to include the most recent data reported to MDE by Minnesota School Districts, Charter Schools, and other educational organizations.

horizpa.horizpar:
Each school district checks the previous year's map for accuracy of school names, district boundaries and public school building locations. Locations are modified through a weekly process of reviewing updated program physical addresses against various sources (aerial photography, geocoding).
All other school locations (charters, nonpublic, post-secondary, etc.) were brought forward from database records at MDE and spatially located using address matching techniques and most current aerial photography. All locations have been reviewed or edited at least once since January 1, 2020. Each review uses various sources to determine location accuracy, such as address information, online mapping platforms, geocoding, aerial photography, county parcel and address data, commercial and publicly provided basemap layers, and reviews of program websites. Most records have been verified against multiple sources when determining the horizontal position.
In determining the precise location for each record, the following decision criteria were used: 1. Programs using the same physical address are co-located. (Note that some large buildings will be referenced with multiple building numbers in the address, and that some specific addresses are used to reference multiple buildings.) 2. A program "point" is placed within a parcel with the same address number (if that exists). If none exists, the remaining rules are still followed. 3. A point is placed on top of the building footprint (if visible). 4. A point is placed closest to the street with a matching name to the address, if possible within the other rules.
Since it is impossible to meet all of these rules for every record, some subjectivity exists in the placement of points.

procstep.procdesc:
For the lineage of this dataset from prior years, refer to the metadata packaged with the historical resource offerings in the MN Geospatial Commons.
As an approximation of the change for the current school year, the following statistics are provided: 1,314 records have been updated since January 1, 2023. 85 records have been created since January 1, 2023.

overview.eaover:
List of columns via a sample record: OBJECTID: 2061 ORGID: 10625357000 ORGTYPE: 01 ORGNUMBER: 0625 SCHNUMBER: 357 FORMID: 0625-01-357 GISNAME: E-STEM Middle School MDENAME: E-STEM Middle School ALTNAME: <Null> GISADDR: 600 Weir Dr, Woodbury, MN 55125 MDEADDR: 600 Weir Drive, Woodbury, MN 55125 PUBPRIV: Public LOCTYPE: Member GRADERANGE: 45085 CLASS: 20 MAGNET: NO LOCDISTID: 10833000000 LOCDISTNAME: South Washington County COUNTYCODE: 27163 COUNTYNAME: Washington FED_SCHNUM: 273384005210 WEB_URL: http://spps.org YEAR: SY2023-24 CREATEDT: 2018-10-01 UPDATEDT: 2021-09-27
Details on selected individual columns:
ORGID: A unique identifier for the program/location, used by MDE in internal databases. This is a numeric representation of the ORGTYPE, ORGNUMBER, and SCHNUMBER columns, followed at the end by '000'. example: 1 0001 002 000 is Rippleside Elementary example: 89 8016 010 000 is Aitkin Public Library (Spaces are used in the above examples for readability; spaces are not used in the data itself.)
ORGTYPE: MDE Organization Classification, derived from MDE ORG database. Left-padded with a zero for a 2-character representation. Code reference: 01 - Independent districts 02 - Common districts 03 - Special Districts (Minneapolis and South St. Paul only) 04 - Technical college 06 - Intermediate districts and Schools 07 - Charter school 08 - MDE multi-district school designation 21 - Community colleges 22 - State universities 23 - University of Minnesota system 24 - Private colleges 25 - Community/Technical Colleges 31 - Nonpublic School in Independent Districts 32 - Nonpublic School in Common Districts 33 - Nonpublic School in Special Districts 34 - Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) Tribal Schools 36 - NonPublic Archdiocese 50 - Miscellaneous Cooperatives 51 - Vocational Cooperatives 52 - Special Education Cooperatives 60 - Correctional Facilities 61 - Education Districts 62 - Secondary Facilities Cooperatives 70 - State Operated Schools 75 - Residential Facilities-Neglected/Delinquent 80 - Adult Basic Education (ABE) 82 - Regional Mgmt Information Center-RMIC 83 - Service Cooperative-ECSU 86 - Library Minitex Location 88 - Library Network/Cooperative 89 - Library
ORGNUMBER: MDE school district (or other organization) number, derived from MDE ORG database. Left-padded with zeroes for a 4-character representation.
SCHNUMBER: MDE school number (or other member identifier), derived from MDE ORG database. Left-padded with zeroes for a 3-character representation.
FORMID: A concatenation of ORGNUMBER, ORGTYPE, and SCHNUMBER, separated by dashes. This is a "formatted ID" that can be used to look up the location details in the MDE ORG reporting pages.
GISNAME: School name stored in the spatial database. Once a school is established in the database, this is generally a simplification or a more detailed description of the school, depending on which makes the record more unique. Schools that have changed names since being established in the spatial database are not always updated in this column, although annual synching is attempted. In some cases this name is an abbreviation used for ease in map labeling.
MDENAME: "Preferred" school name stored in the MDE ORG database. This data is updated more frequently, but is complementary to SCHNAME. For example, ORGIDNUM 10912051000 has a preferred name of merely "ESY" in MDE ORG, but the spatial database provides a more unique description as "Milaca ESY".
ALTNAME : a column for storage of alternate names. Particularly useful when labeling school district offices with the short name for the school district, or libraries with a shorter name.
GISADDR: a concatenation of the ADDRESS, CITY, and ZIP columns from the spatial database (with a static "MN" inserted for geocoding/mailing purposes). Much like GISNAME vs. MDENAME, the address data stored with the spatial database may be better, worse, or just different than what is stored in MDE ORG.
MDEADDR: a similar concatenation of address fields, but from the MDE ORG database (using physical address information where available). Note that mailing addresses are stored separately in the MDE ORG database, and not reflected in this dataset.
PUBPRIV: a classification intended to demonstrate whether a program is public, or nonpublic/private Private or Nonpublic - All locations with ORGTYPE IN (24,31,32,33,36) Public - All other locations (ORGTYPE NOT IN (24,31,32,33,36))
LOCTYPE: a classification intended to demonstrate whether or not a location is the "Head" (Parent) record, such as a school district or charter office, or a "Member" (Child) record, such as an individual school program location. These designations reflect the SCHNUMBER column (000 vs non-zero), serving as a vehicle for more general categorization.
Some common uses of the above columns include:
1. School district offices have "000000" at the end of the ORGID column because they represent the Head record for schools within the district. Examples include Minneapolis (30001000000), Fridley (10013000000) or St. Paul (10625000000). Public district offices can be isolated with a query of: ORGTYPE IN ('01', '02', '03') and SCHNUMBER = '000'.
2. Charter schools - Charters are their own local education authority (LEA), operating much like a district. Therefore, there is a "Head" location for each charter license carrying the "000000" at the end of the ORGID column. There may be 2, 3, 4 or more locations based on the charter but there will always be 1 record for each charter organization and at least 1 record for a campus/school. The charters may also be housed on a single location or in several locations. To query a unique list of all Charter school organizations, query ORGTYPE = '07' And SCHNUMBER = '000'.
If you want all charter school campus locations, even when there are multiples per charter, then query ORGTYPE = '07' And SCHNUMBER <> '000'
GRADERANGE: Grade levels pulled from the MDE ORG database. There is wide variation within this column, and should not be used to "classify" different types of schools. (See the CLASS column.) Some examples: EC - Early Childhood Program PK - Pre-Kindergarten KG - Kindergarten 1 to 12 - Grades 1 to 12
CLASS: MDE school site classification, pulled from the MDE ORG database. Available for general classifications. 0,' ', or Blank - No site classification; generally in "Head" records, nonpublic records, or records where the organization type is not a school district. 10 - Elem (PK-6) 20 - Midd (5-8) 31 - Junior High (7-8 or 7-9) 32 - Senior High (9-12) 33 - Secondary (7-12) 40 - Elem/Sec Combo 41 - ALC 42 - ALP 43 - Private Alternative Program 45 - Targeted Services 46 - Distance Learning 50 - Special Education 51 - Special Education ESY 55 - Combined Spec Ed * Voc Ed Programs 60 - Secondary Vocational Program 70 - Delinquent Student/Correctional Program 71 - Miscellaneous Program 72 - Neglected Student Program, Title 1 73 - Homeless Student Program, Title 1 74 - Hospital/Medical Program 75 - Telecommunications District 76 - Educational Oversight to Private Res Care 77 - Educational Oversight to Public Res Care 78 - Educational Oversight to Private Day Treatment 79 - Educational Oversight to Public Day Treatment 82 - Community & Adult Education Program Note that because nonpublic schools are not classified with this column, there is no way to discretely identify "nonpublic elementary schools".
MAGNET: Magnet school (YES/NO)
LOCDISTID: Unique MDE ORG number for the school district within which the program is located. This is derived by location, and for public, non-charter schools, will typically reflect the ORGID of the school district, although there are exceptions. This identifier can be useful for queries such as, "how many nonpublic schools operate within district X?"
LOCDISTNAME: School district name within which the program is located; like LOCDISTID, this is derived via location.
COUNTYCODE: State standard, 5-digit County FIPS codes, derived from where the program site is located.
COUNTYNAME: County name, derived from where the program site is located.
FED_SCHNUM: National Center for Educational Statistics (NCES) school identification number. The first 2 digits are Minnesota's state number (27). The next 5 digits are the District school designation. This will be the same for each school in that district. The final 5 numbers are the school identifier. Note that these identifiers do NOT align with MDE's organization identifiers.
Example: Aitkin School District Office 01 0001 000 000 FED_SCHNUM=27 02760 (2702760) Aitkin Sec. 01 0001 001 000 FED_SCHNUM=27 02760 00057 (270276000057) Rippleside El. 01 0001 002 000 FED_SCHNUM=27 02760 00059 (270276000059)
City Academy Charter (District) 01 4000 000 000 FED_SCHNUM=27 08955 (2708955) City Academy Charter (School) 01 4000 010 000 FED_SCHNUM=27 08955 00016 (270895500016)
WEB_URL: website address for the school/district, derived from MDE ORG database
YEAR: School year of data.
CREATEDT: date program location was entered in the database (system generated).
UPDATEDT: date program location was last updated in the database (system generated).
overview.eadetcit: More information on data derived from MDE ORG, including reference data on organization types and school site classification, are available at https://public.education.mn.gov/MdeOrgView/

distinfo.distliab:
The Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) does not warrant the results you may obtain by using this dataset. This dataset is provided ''as is'' without express or implied warranties, including warranties of merchantability and fitness. In no event will MDE be liable for any consequential, incidental or special damages, including any lost profits or lost savings, even if an MDE representative has been advised of the possibility of such damages or any other claim by any third party.
In obtaining this data from MDE and MnGeo, it is understood that you and/or your organization have the right to use it for any purpose. If you modify it, you are encouraged to apply responsible best practices by documenting those changes in a metadata record. If you transmit or provide the data to another user, it is your responsibility to provide appropriate content, limitation, warranty and liability information as you see fit.
MnGeo's disclaimer is online: https://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/disclaimer.html
